wikipedia_page.main: Gideon John Davies (born 06 July 1964) FRS FRSC FMedSci in the York Structural Biology Laboratory (YSBL) at the University of York, UK.  Davies is best known for his ground-breaking studies into carbohydrate-active enzymes, notably analysing the conformational and mechanistic basis for catalysis and applying this for societal benefit.  In 2016 Davies was made the Royal Society Ken Murray Research Professor at the University of York.

response: *Gideon Davies FRS FRSC FMedSci structural and chemical biologist working on structural biology, carbohydrates and glycobiology

Dodson was head of the structural biology laboratories at the University of York and National Institute for Medical Research, London. During his career he collaborated with many scientists including Dale Wigley, Gideon Davies, Andrzej Brzozowski, Leo Brady and Max Perutz.
